name: Marbles (17 Bit Software)
overview: Game written in AMOS. Coding, graphics & music/sound FX by Ola Zandelin. Additional level design by Daniel Zandelin. Game includes a built-in construction kit and instructions. Game is available on 17-Bit PD disk #3305, PD-Soft disk #4248 and Assassins CD#2. Inspired by Tony Crowther's BOMBUZAL, the very first version of MARBLES developed was called BB BALL and was never officially released. A few years later, the graphics were updated, a construction kit included and the name was changed to MARBLES when coder Ola Zandelin finally released his first complete version of the game in 1991 to the eager Amiga masses.
